global.description.message: Alejandro's personal site, a blog about everything, especially my path in Open Science

homepage.description.descriptionLine_4.message: I contribute to open source initiatives

homepage.description.descriptionLine_3.message: I share knowledge through my Blog

Recurso dirigido por la comunidad para v.message: Community-driven resource to support the publication of data, research and tools in environmental science

Con la plétora de datos abiertos y recur.message: With the plethora of open data and computational resources available, environmental data science research and applications have rapidly accelerated. Therefore, there is an opportunity to propose a new cyberinfrastructure to collect and classify open source research and applications in environmental systems (polar, oceans, forests, agriculture, etc.). Inspired by the Pangeo Gallery, we propose The Environmental Data Science book (https://the-environmental-ds-book.netlify.app), a community-driven online resource that showcases and supports the publication of data, research, and open source developments in environmental science. The target audience and early adopters are

cualquier persona interesada en herramie.message: anyone interested in open source tools for environmental science

cualquier persona interesada en la repro.message: anyone interested in reproducibility, inclusiveness, sharing and collaboration aspects of AI and data science for environmental applications

Siguiendo los principios FAIR del inglés.message: Following the FAIR (findable, accessible, interoperable and reusable) principles, the resource offers multiple features such as guidelines, templates, persistent URLs and Binder to facilitate fully documented, shareable and reproducible content. The quality of published content is assured by a transparent review process supported by GitHub-related technologies. To date, the community has successfully published seven Python-based executable content: one agriculture, two forestry, two forest/savanna fire, one ocean research, and one polar research. The content uses open source Python libraries, such as intake, iris, xarray and hvplot, for interactive visualization and modeling of environmental sensor data. In addition to constant feature enhancements to the GitHub repository we hope to increase contributions from other programming languages, e. g. Julia and R, and to organize more community activities (collaboration and coworking sessions) to improve scientific software practices in the environmental science community.

The Turing Way es un libro, una comunida.message: The Turing Way is a book, a community and a global collaboration for reproducible, ethical and collaborative data science

The Turing Way es una guía práctica para.message: The Turing Way is a practical guide to reproducible, ethical and collaborative data science. We support a diverse community of collaborators to make data science accessible, understandable, and effective for all. Our goal is to provide all the information that researchers and data scientists in academia, industry, and the public sector need at the start of their projects to ensure that they are easy to reproduce at the end.

The Turing Way comenzó en 2019 como una.message: The Turing Way began in 2019 as a small data science guide, and has since expanded into a much more comprehensive manual consisting of multiple guides covering several topics: Reproducible Research, Project Design, Communication, Collaboration, and Ethical Research. Each guide offers chapters on a variety of topics covering best practices and recommendations. These chapters have been co-written by contributors who are students, researchers, teachers, community leaders, policy makers and practitioners of diverse backgrounds, lived experience and domain knowledge.

Todas las partes interesadas, incluyendo.message: All interested parties, including students, researchers, software engineers, project leaders and founding teams, are invited to use The Turing Way to understand their roles and responsibilities in data science reproducibility. You can read the book online, contribute to the project as described in our guidelines for contributing to the project, and reuse all materials (see License).

En esta comunidad, he contribuido a la e.message: In this community, I have contributed to the evaluation and implementation of content translation into other languages, particularly Spanish. I have also participated in the Book Dash meetings, in which the community meets to create and review content.

Comunidad que ayuda a los investigadores.message: Community helping early career researchers become ambassadors for Open Science

La iniciativa OLS ayuda a los individuos.message: The OLS initiative helps individuals and research stakeholders become Open Science ambassadors. It has a 16-week training program under which participants (organisers, hosts, mentors and project leaders/mentees):

comparten su experiencia y adquieren los.message: share their experience and acquire the essential knowledge to create, manage and maintain an Open Science project

conectar con miembros de diferentes proy.message: connecting with members from different projects, communities, backgrounds and identities

se capacitarán mutuamente para convertir.message: train each other to become effective Open Science ambassadors in their communities

Adicional al programa, OLS construye una.message: In addition to the program, OLS builds a community of which I am proudly a part since I was a student with the Environmental Data Science book project. Under this program and my cohort (OLS-4) I made a substantial improvement to the resource under the guidance of my mentor, Delphine Lariviere. The experience as a participant was very rewarding with a very interesting cohort, organisers and expert guests. My involvement transcended being a mentee, and for example in the next cohort, OLS5, I am participating as a mentor for a Multilingual Open Science project in Central Asia. My support for this particular project is linked to my contributions in translating The Turing Way online resource.
